body_html:
it fails on the cmake step with cuda not found - on this ubuntu machine I do not have Nvidia nor cuda. So, I copied the libnnpack files to another system with cuda support and surprisingly the build did not fail there (with the exact same binary libnnpack.so file!). So, the build fails only on a system with no cuda. I got this from cmake on the system where it fails:

CMake Error at cmake/FindCUDA/FindCUDA.cmake:644 (message):
Specify CUDA_TOOLKIT_ROOT_DIR
Call Stack (most recent call first):
CMakeLists.txt:380 (find_package)

CMake Error: The following variables are used in this project, but they are set to NOTFOUND.
Please set them or make sure they are set and tested correctly in the CMake files:
CUDA_TOOLKIT_INCLUDE (ADVANCED)
used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "/home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".

body:
it fails on the cmake step with cuda not found - on this ubuntu machine I do not have Nvidia nor cuda. So, I copied the libnnpack files to another system with cuda support and surprisingly the build did not fail there (with the exact same binary libnnpack.so file!). So, the build fails only on a system with no cuda. I got this from cmake on the system where it fails:

CMake Error at cmake/FindCUDA/FindCUDA.cmake:644 (message):
  Specify CUDA_TOOLKIT_ROOT_DIR
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:380 (find_package)


CMake Error: The following variables are used in this project, but they are set to NOTFOUND.
Please set them or make sure they are set and tested correctly in the CMake files:
CUDA_TOOLKIT_INCLUDE (ADVANCED)
   used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
   used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
   used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
   used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
   used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten
   used as include directory in directory /home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "/home/tester/Downloads/Install/pytorch/aten/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
